item.title: Bulletin updated at 22:02 HKT 14/07/2023
item.description:
At 10 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 31 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 75 per cent

The tropical depression over the seas west of Luzon is moving slowly at a distance of about 700 km southeast of Hong Kong. The Observatory will consider issuing the Standby Signal, No. 1 before 6 a.m. tomorrow (15 July). The tropical depression is expected to gradually intensify in the next couple of days and move in the general direction of western Guangdong and Hainan Island. Whether a higher Tropical Cyclone Warning Signal will be issued depends on the proximity of the tropical cyclone to the Pearl River Estuary and whether it will intensify significantly. The weather over the coast of Guangdong is expected to deteriorate gradually from Sunday (16 July) to Monday (17 July). Winds will also strengthen gradually. Seas will be rough with swells. Please pay attention to the latest weather information issued by the Observatory.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning is now in force. The weather is extremely hot and there is prolonged heat! Please pay attention to health conditions. Drink more water and take all necessary protective measures against the heat. Avoid vigorous outdoor physical activities. If feeling unwell, seek medical advice as soon as possible.
